comment: Ive had 4 prof at ksu. His tests are by far the best. class average test1: 65 Test2:90. HW is for grades not for study. Study only problems he gives or teaches in lecture and youll do fine. He did not waste much time on material not covered in the tests. His jokes can come off rude but just press through it. Sometimes his grading seems harsh.

The Webassign Homework looks nothing like the problems in class. Doesn't really explain things too well. Has group assignments at the end of every class (take that how you will). Uploads the notes from every class. I would have taken someone else if I could, but he's alright, I guess.

He's very organized and so are his lectures. He writes on his tablet and uploads the notes so they are available after each class. Each class there is a group problem for a grade. I found this to be helpful. Tests were similar to homework and SI sessions were very useful. funny and approachable. I had repeat cal 2 then made an A in ODE with him

IDK, but I had a good experience with him. He was accommodating to my need for extra time, and he didn't make me feel bad for asking questions. I felt that his lectures were pretty thorough. The only thing I would say is that he doesn't amplify himself well and no calculators are allowed. Didn't seem to affect my performance too much.

Easiest math class I've ever taken. Tests are directly from homework questions. 10% In-class exercise everyday (As long as you attend, 10% guaranteed), 10% Homework quizzes once a week(Do your homework, not difficult - Most students get 5-10%), and three tests are 20% each. Just study the lectures on his web page.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Poor lecture skills, only lectures will help you understand the material. Needs to be more lenient with everything and especially tests and random quizzes every week last minute. do not take if you are not a math major. Math 3332. 2017

Dr. Kang knows his stuff well. The problem is that he has trouble communicating that to students. He often goes too fast and asks if we understand all to receive blank stares, but he'll keep going. Ask questions as frequently as possible. His class will definitely take more work on your part, so be ready and do the homework.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: If you want to pass Cal 3, then I'll recommend you not to take this professor. I didn't learn anything and his test are ridiculous hard. He doesn't allow students to calculators during exam which makes it even harder. Gives too much homework and he barely explains how to do the homework. SAVE YOUR TIME & MONEY AND DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!!!!

By far my favorite math professor I've taken in College. I took him for differential equations, and he did a great job of explaining the material, and his daily quizzes are very useful resource for learning the material. Tests are not very difficult, but do require knowing the material as there are no formula sheets. Attendance is mandatory w quiz
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: I had a good experience with Dr. Kang as a teacher. He may go a little bit fast at times through the lecture, but that is made up for by mini quizzes that are given after almost every class where you're able to work in groups. He also posts his detailed lecture notes online which really helps with  completing the homework if you don't write notes.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: I enjoyed his class but if math isn't your best subject, I wouldn't reccomend. He is a really nice guy and likes his students, but believes math should be done his way  (you'll get counted off for missing parentheses, etc). As someone below said, spends a lot of time conversing and not teaching. No calculators/formula sheets.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Very hard to understand and doesn't give clear instructions on how to solve problems. I'm not sure how he is in person, but avoid taking him online at all costs.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: I took Calc 1 with professor Kang, he did not offer any extra credit and did not let us use a calculator, cheat sheet, or any form of help on tests. The homework was alright, it was lengthy but average on difficulty. Professor Kang was a hard teach I would not recommend.
I took him for Calc I, and he was okay. There are a lot of homework from WebAssign and only three tests. He drops the lowest test grade with the final.

He does have a little bit of an accent but you'll get used to it after the first two weeks. The homework is pretty annoying, but if you do all the homework , you will easily ace the exams. He also curves the test and gives a generous amount of partial credit on the exams. So just practice the homework problems and you will be fine.
Great professor. Very good at teaching the class, funny, makes the class enjoyable. The online homework is confusing and irritating, but it's only 10% of your grade. Just ask him for help.
Very good teacher for a bother online h.w help and he also give out a study guide before the test .

He doesn't teach much in class. Spends a lot of time conversing with the class about everything but the subject material. Doesn't do many examples and puts things on tests he may have showed briefly. No calculators allowed or formulas. I would take someone else.

If your going to take Cal 2 take it with this guy. Very cool funny guy. Tests are based off homework so if you do that your good. Couldn't ask for a better professor. He does have an accent tho but it is not bad at all. Overall A+ teacher

Great sense of humor. Notes are all posted online which is very helpful.  Took the time to help every student and went over homework problems every day. No quizzes, just HMWK using WebWork. Tests are over all basic concepts and are never too tricky. Has slight accent, but don't worry about that, he's very understandable. Highly recommend.

Awesome professor! He's a really nice professor and does his best to help you if you're confused. He uses his laptop and the screen for taking notes. Attendance is pretty important. His tests are fairly easy. They cover each section of the notes. If you study, come to class and work hard you will do well and enjoy his class!

Great teacher! I had him for precalc and plan to take him for calc. He's very nice and does his best to help when you don't understand. He uses his laptop and the screen so notes are easy to take. I definitely recommend taking him!

He's pretty average as a math teacher. Gives hw after each section, that isnt due till test day, 4 total tests plus final. He drops your lowest test grade. as far as notes go, he uses his laptop which is pretty advanced  and clearer compared to chalk. I did not find him as helpful as I would of wanted, but in the end after talking to him, passed me

Great teacher! Questions from homework and classwork are seen on tests. Not hard to understand at all.  He made calculus 2 very easy compared to what I heard about it.  Also make sure you can see the screen because he uses it every day.

Very Good teacher! Took him for precalculus and couldnt ask for a more awesome teacher. Very helpful, and really wants to see his students do well too. And very nice person as well. Would recommend to everyone to take him.

Great professor! His English is great compared to other math professors. He may have to process what you say, but you will not have a problem understanding him. Go to class, be respectful, stay off the phone and computer while in class. Uses the screen so there is not a bad seat in the house. Highly recommend/ would take another course he teaches.
